attributes.comment:
As a prospective adoptive parent of a child in China, I understand that paperwork
is necessary. Due to the increased wait time I have to had redo my I-171 for an
extension, resulting in double the fees. While no one wants to pay the the pricey
fee amounts, it is extremely frustrating that our government places expiration
dates on fingerprints and I-171, both of which are necessary for me to bring my
future daughter home. Like other parents, we had to have our home study
completed before we could apply for our I-171. In the beginning we thought we
would have had a 6-8 month wait but shortly after we were logged in, the wait
began to extend. Due to the fact that most countries are taking longer to process
adoptions, I think it only fair that our own govt extend the expiration dates on
documents. I think to increase the fees to the proposed amounts is also adding
insult to injury since it also takes so long to get documents processed. Maybe
with these additional fees you can hire more personnel to staff your offices.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Kimberly B. Luallen
